result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
From State dated 10/26/16 requesting JOC be amended.
Reviewed by Judge Maxwell 10/27/16; Prepare amended JOC that adds the restitution.

Defendant Gregory C Maier in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 16CF52. Court grants the State's motion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory C Maier in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting plea and sentencing date in 90 days. Court grants for 60 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory C Maier in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as his client needs to pay restitution. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Gregory C Maier in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as his client needs time to raise the restitution amount. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Gregory C Maier in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Gregory C Maier in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Piggly Wiggly Store listed in the criminal complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
